doc.ContractDescription: THE GOALS OF THE FINESSE PROJECT ARE ROUGHLY EQUALLY SPLIT BETWEEN OBTAINING TARGETED SCIENCE DATA FROM THE FIELD, AND TESTING A VARIETY OF EXPLORATION SCENARIOS AND CONSTRAINTS (INCLUDING DATA TRANSMISSION RATES, TIME DELAYS BETWEEN THE ROVER/ASTRONAUT TEAM AND MISSION CONTROL AREAS, AND HUMAN-ROBOT INTERACTIONS). THE SCIENCE QUESTIONS TO BE INVESTIGATED WOULD PRODUCE USEFUL NEW INFORMATION ABOUT BOTH STUDY SITES, BUT THE SCIENCE OBJECTIVES ARE NOT VERY BROAD IN SCOPE AS THEY ARE CONSTRAINED BY THE INSTRUMENTS TO BE USED BY BOTH THE ROBOTIC AND HUMAN EXPLORERS. THE EXPECTED SCIENCE RESULTS ARE LIMITED, RESTRICTED TO THE DATA TO BE COLLECTED BY THE AVAILABLE INSTRUMENTS. THE EXPLORATION RATIONALE IS VERY WELL LAID OUT IN THE PROPOSAL, DESIGNED TO TEST MANY ATTRIBUTES OF POSSIBLE FUTURE EXPLORATION EFFORTS IN WAYS THAT WOULD PROVIDE USEFUL INFORMATION FOR ESTABLISHING STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES OF SEVERAL EXPLORATION STRATEGIES. THE TEAM HAS BOTH THE SCIENTIFIC AND EXPLORATION/HARDWARE BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED TO CARRY OUT THE WORK AS PROPOSED, BUT THE SPECIFIC ROLES OF THE PI AND DEPUTY PI OFTEN ARE NOT CLEARLY DELINEATED. COSTS ARE REASONABLE, AND THE PROPOSED WORK IS CLEARLY RELEVANT TO BOTH SCIENCE AND EXPLORATION ASPECTS OF NASA. THE RESEARCH PLAN ALSO INCLUDES MANY ATTRIBUTES THAT ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO SSERVI GOALS, SUCH AS EXTENSIVE USE OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS DURING ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT.
